title: 2  Introduction
section: 4.1 Subset of datasets created from the worldbankdata

title: 3  A: geom_a
text:
3.1 geom_area

3.1.1 Package
ggplot2 (Wickham 2016)


3.1.2 Description
Create an area plot. This cover the space between x-axis and line that connects the data points.


3.1.3 Understandable aesthetics
alpha, colour, linetype, linewidth


3.1.4 The statistical transformation to use on the data for this layer

stat_identity: Uses the y-values directly to define the are



3.1.5 See also
geom_line, geom_ribbon


3.1.6 Example

area <- worldbankdata |>
  filter(Country == "Bangladesh") |> 
  filter(Year >= 2013 & Year <= 2021) |>
  ggplot(aes(x=Year, y=Electricity)) + 
  geom_area(alpha=0.5) + 
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1)) + 
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 2013:2021) + 
  labs(title = "geom_area only")

areapoint <- area + geom_point(col="red") + 
  labs(title = "geom_area and geom_point")
area | areapoint

title: 3  A: geom_a
text:
3.2 geom_abline
Package:  ggplot2 (R-ggplot2?)
Book: 
Description:  Draw a straight line (\(Y=mX+c\)) for a given slope (\(m\)) and intercept (\(c\)).
Understandable aesthetics: alpha, colour, linetype, linewidth
Statistics layer(s):
See also:  geom_point, geom_vline, geom_hline
Example:

abline <- ggplot(worldbankdata, aes(y = Cooking, x=Electricity)) +  geom_abline(intercept = 0, slope = 1) + 
  labs(title="A: `geom_abline` only") +
  theme(aspect.ratio = 1)

pointabline <- abline + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme(aspect.ratio = 1)

library(patchwork)
abline | pointabline

Warning: Removed 6051 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).





Illustration of (A) geom_abline and (B) use of geom_point and geom_abline both








Wickham, Hadley. 2016. Ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis. Springer-Verlag New York. https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org.
